protocol_name: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
protocol_name_html: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
description:
MegaLong™ isolates high molecular weight (>100kb) genomic DNA from a variety of samples, including animal tissues, cultured cells, whole blood, bacterial and yeast.

 

The protocol described here is for blood samples. Please refer to the appropriate protocol, depending on your application.

collections.protocol_name: MegaLong™ Protocols Collection for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA
collections.protocol_name_html: MegaLong™ Protocols Collection for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA

guidelines:
INTRODUCTION 

MegaLong™ isolates high molecular weight (>100kb) genomic DNA from a variety of samples, including animal tissues, cultured cells, whole blood, bacterial and yeast.  MegaLong™ uses Genomic Tube-O-DIALYZER™, a unique micro dialysis device with a 0.45µm membrane, which minimizes sample manipulation, one of the main reasons for DNA breakage.  MegaLong™ isolates nuclei under mild extraction conditions and releases genomic DNA by digestion of nuclear proteins with a highly active LongLife™ Proteinase K. The digestion is performed in the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ and after digestion the Tube-ODIALYZER™ is inverted to dialyze away digested protein and other impurities leaving behind highly pure and fully hydrated genomic DNA.  


The fragile, high molecular weight genomic DNA can be stored in the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ to further minimize mechanical manipulation of the DNA. The DNA is suitable for Southern blot analysis, recovery of Lambda shuttle vectors from transgenic animals, PCR, analysis by pulsed-field electrophoresis or any application where genomic DNA is required.


APPLICATIONS

MegaLong™ kit can be used for the isolation of genomic DNA from animal tissues, cultured cells, whole blood, bacterial and yeast.  For samples unsuitable for the isolation of high molecular weight DNA with MegaLong™, G-Biosciences recommends using the OmniPrep™ Genomic DNA isolation kit (Cat. # 786-136). 


The kit is supplied as a Micro or Large packs to process either 25 or 50 1-25mg samples.   


 ITEM(S) SUPPLIED

 Description Cat. # 786-146 Cat. # 786-147
Nuclei Isolation Buffe 2 x 30ml 4 x 30ml
Suspension Buffer 1 x 10ml 2 x 10ml
Digestion Buffer 1 x 2ml 2 x 2ml
LongLife™ Proteinase K [5mg/ml] 2 x 0.5ml 4 x 0.5ml
Genomic Tube-O-Dialyzer™      25      50
Floats (Medi)        6    6
Caps (Medi)    25        50
Forceps    1    1

 

 

 
 
STORAGE CONDITION

The kit is shipped at ambient temperature. Upon arrival, store LongLife™ Proteinase K at -20°C and remaining components at 4°C.  LongLife™ Proteinase K solution is stable for 1 year, if stored properly.


ADDITIONAL MATERIALS REQUIRED 

• Microfuge tubes & pestles (Cat. # 786-138P) 

• TE buffer

components.data: On ice, add 5-400µl blood to a Tube-O-DIALYZER™ and centrifuge at 5,000xg for 5 minutes to pellet cells. Discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: On ice, add 5-400µl blood to a Tube-O-DIALYZER™ and centrifuge at 5,000xg for 5 minutes to pellet cells. Discard the supernatant.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 500µl Nuclei Isolation Buffer. Invert the tube 2-3 times to suspend the cells, incubate for 10 minutes on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500µl Nuclei Isolation Buffer. Invert the tube 2-3 times to suspend the cells, incubate for 10 minutes on ice.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ cap in a beaker of TE buffer and store at 4°C until required.  Rinse the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ tube with TE buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ cap in a beaker of TE buffer and store at 4°C until required.  Rinse the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ tube with TE buffer.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: With a pipette transfer the supernatant to the Tube-O-DIALYZER™, ensuring the settled cellular debris is left behind.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With a pipette transfer the supernatant to the Tube-O-DIALYZER™, ensuring the settled cellular debris is left behind.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place a supplied cap on the tube and centrifuge at 16,000xg for 5 minutes to pellet the nuclei.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a supplied cap on the tube and centrifuge at 16,000xg for 5 minutes to pellet the nuclei.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Carefully discard the supernatant and invert the tube on a paper towel to remove excess supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully discard the supernatant and invert the tube on a paper towel to remove excess supernatant.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 70µl Suspension Buffer to the nuclei and gently rock or tap the tube to dislodge the nuclei.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 70µl Suspension Buffer to the nuclei and gently rock or tap the tube to dislodge the nuclei.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Vortex the LongLife™ Proteinase K and add 10µl to the nuclei.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex the LongLife™ Proteinase K and add 10µl to the nuclei.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 70µl Digestion Buffer and mix with gentle rocking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 70µl Digestion Buffer and mix with gentle rocking.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate at 55°C for 2-4 hours with periodic rocking.  Do not vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 55°C for 2-4 hours with periodic rocking.  Do not vortex.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Tissue Sample)
source_data.protocol_name: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
source_data.protocol_name_html: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
source_data.annotation: NOTE: For periodic rocking, gently invert the tube 2-3 times every 30 minutes.
source_data.thread_text: NOTE: For periodic rocking, gently invert the tube 2-3 times every 30 minutes.
source_data.body: NOTE: For periodic rocking, gently invert the tube 2-3 times every 30 minutes.

components.data: After digestion is complete, centrifuge the tube for 20 seconds at 1,000g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After digestion is complete, centrifuge the tube for 20 seconds at 1,000g.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Replace the cap with the dialysis cap. Do not discard the storage cap as this will be required for storage of DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Replace the cap with the dialysis cap. Do not discard the storage cap as this will be required for storage of DNA.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ upside down in a 50ml centrifuge tube and centrifuge at 1000xg for 30 seconds to bring the sample onto the dialysis membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ upside down in a 50ml centrifuge tube and centrifuge at 1000xg for 30 seconds to bring the sample onto the dialysis membrane.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 14 of MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Tissue Sample)
source_data.protocol_name: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
source_data.protocol_name_html: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
source_data.annotation: NOTE: Do not centrifuge longer or faster than stated to prevent damage to membrane and sample loss.
source_data.thread_text: NOTE: Do not centrifuge longer or faster than stated to prevent damage to membrane and sample loss.
source_data.body: NOTE: Do not centrifuge longer or faster than stated to prevent damage to membrane and sample loss.

components.data: Remove the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ from the 50ml tube with forceps and keeping it inverted slide into the provided float and dialyze in 500ml 1X TE buffer at room temperature for 18-24 hours with 2-3 buffer changes.  Gently swirl tube to mix contents at each buffer change.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ from the 50ml tube with forceps and keeping it inverted slide into the provided float and dialyze in 500ml 1X TE buffer at room temperature for 18-24 hours with 2-3 buffer changes.  Gently swirl tube to mix contents at each buffer change.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 15 of MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Tissue Sample)
source_data.protocol_name: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
source_data.protocol_name_html: MegaLong™ Protocol for Isolation of >100kb Genomic DNA (Blood)
source_data.annotation: NOTE: Cloudy DNA is an indication of incomplete dialysis, therefore dialyze for an additional 24 hours. Change dialysis buffer and mix the content of the Tube-ODIALYZER™ by gently swirling every few hours.
source_data.thread_text: NOTE: Cloudy DNA is an indication of incomplete dialysis, therefore dialyze for an additional 24 hours. Change dialysis buffer and mix the content of the Tube-ODIALYZER™ by gently swirling every few hours.
source_data.body: NOTE: Cloudy DNA is an indication of incomplete dialysis, therefore dialyze for an additional 24 hours. Change dialysis buffer and mix the content of the Tube-ODIALYZER™ by gently swirling every few hours.

components.data: Following dialysis the genomic DNA may be concentrated in the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ using either Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Concentrator (Cat. # 786-144) or Concentrator Solution (Cat. # 786-143). Simply prepare the Concentrator as per the instructions and invert the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ containing your DNA in the solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Following dialysis the genomic DNA may be concentrated in the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ using either Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Concentrator (Cat. # 786-144) or Concentrator Solution (Cat. # 786-143). Simply prepare the Concentrator as per the instructions and invert the Tube-O-DIALYZER™ containing your DNA in the solution.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: If concentration is not required or following concentration, centrifuge the tube at 1000xg for 1 minute. Replace the dialysis cap with the normal cap.  The genomic DNA is now ready for use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If concentration is not required or following concentration, centrifuge the tube at 1000xg for 1 minute. Replace the dialysis cap with the normal cap.  The genomic DNA is now ready for use.

components.data: Tube-O-DIALYZER™ Preparation
components.name: Section
